title: Homemade Cheddar Biscuits
description: These deliciously simple homemade cheddar biscuits easily rival Red Lobster’s cheddar bay biscuits. Baked in only about 20 minutes, they’re a must-try for brunch or dinnertime.
ingredients: 2 and 1/2 cups (313g) all-purpose flour (spooned & leveled), plus more as needed for hands and work surface
1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, cubed and very cold
1 teaspoon dried or fresh chopped parsley
instructions: Make the biscuits: Place the flour, baking powder, baking soda, garlic powder, and salt together in a large bowl or in a large food processor. Whisk or pulse until combined. Add the cubed butter and cut into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter or by pulsing several times in the processor. Cut/pulse until coarse crumbs form. If you used a food processor, pour the mixture into a large bowl.

Fold in the shredded cheese. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Pour 1 cup (240ml) buttermilk and drizzle honey on top. Fold everything together with a large spoon or spatula until it begins to come together. Do not overwork the dough. The dough will be shaggy and crumbly with some wet spots.

Pour the dough and any dough crumbles onto a floured work surface and gently bring together with generously floured hands. The dough will become sticky as you bring it together. Have extra flour nearby and use it often to flour your hands and work surface in this step. Using floured hands, flatten into a 3/4-inch-thick rectangle as best you can. Fold one side into the center, then the other side on top. Turn the dough horizontally. Gently flatten into a 3/4-inch-thick rectangle again. Repeat the folding again. Turn the dough horizontally one more time. Gently flatten into a 3/4-inch-thick rectangle. Repeat the folding one last time. Flatten into the final 3/4-inch-thick rectangle.

Cut into 2.5- or 3-inch circles with a biscuit cutter. Re-roll scraps until all the dough is used. You should have about 8–10 biscuits. Arrange in a 10-inch cast iron skillet or close together on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Make sure the biscuits are touching.
Brush the tops with remaining buttermilk. Bake for 18–22 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Remove from the oven.
Make the topping: Mix the topping ingredients together. Generously brush on the warm biscuits, and serve warm.
Cover leftovers tightly and store at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
tips: Make sure to not overwork the dough to keep the biscuits light and flaky. Also, do not twist the biscuit cutter when pressing down into the dough because this seals off the edges of the biscuit, which prevents them from fully rising.

structured_content.content: These homemade cheddar biscuits are a delightful addition to any meal, whether it's brunch or dinner. With a perfect balance of flavors and a light, flaky texture, they're sure to impress your guests.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 40 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for brunch or dinner
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Can be made ahead and frozen for later use

structured_content.content: These biscuits bring back memories of family brunches during the holidays. The smell of them baking in the oven is enough to make anyone's mouth water.

• Main ingredient: All-purpose flour and cold butter are key to achieving the perfect texture.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garlic powder and cheddar cheese add a savory depth to these biscuits.
  • Supporting ingredients: Buttermilk and honey contribute to the moistness and subtle sweetness.
  • Equipment needed: A biscuit cutter and a large bowl or food processor are essential tools for this recipe.

Preparation:
Combine the dry ingredients and cut in the cold butter until coarse crumbs form. Fold in the cheese, buttermilk, and honey.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Shape the dough and cut out the biscuits. Bake until golden brown.
Finishing Touches:
Brush the warm biscuits with a mixture of melted butter, garlic powder, and parsley.

upload.context: Beautiful homemade cheddar biscuits with a golden brown top and a light, flaky texture

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Do not overwork the dough to keep the biscuits light and flaky.
  • Do not twist the biscuit cutter when pressing down into the dough.
  • The biscuits are ready when the tops are golden brown.
  • Leftovers can be stored at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

structured_content.content: These biscuits are a hit at every family gathering. They're a reminder of the simple pleasures in life - good food and good company.
For an extra kick, try adding some chopped jalapenos or a dash of cayenne pepper to the dough. You could also experiment with different types of cheese for a unique twist.
These biscuits are perfect served alongside a hearty stew or soup. They're also great for soaking up the sauce in a plate of shrimp and grits or served with a fried egg for a satisfying breakfast.
For a gluten-free version, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free flour blend. For a dairy-free version, use a dairy-free butter substitute and a vegan cheese.

upload.context: Close-up detail showing the flaky texture and cheesy goodness of the biscuits

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep the butter as cold as possible for flaky biscuits.
  • Use a pastry cutter or food processor to cut the butter into the dry ingredients.
  • Do not overwork the dough to keep the biscuits light and flaky.
  • Brush the tops with buttermilk before baking for a golden brown top.

structured_content.content: With these tips in mind, you're well on your way to making perfect homemade cheddar biscuits. Enjoy the process and the delicious results!
